description:
Elevation gain: 150 m (to lookout). 
Elevation loss: 250 m (from lookout to lake).
The Hidden Lake trail is one of those short gems that anyone can enjoy, at least to the lookout (2.5km). Unfortunately, with a trail this good and this easy, it's like downtown at rush hour on any day in July or August.
Starting at the Logan Pass visitor centre in Glacier National Park
, the trail follows a paved, then boardwalk trail through alpine meadows filled with endless wildflowers. This portion is 2.5km and gains 150m in elevation. At the end is a spectacular viewpoint, overlooking Hidden Lake, Bearhat Mt and Mt Reynolds. Most of the tourists stop here.
The trail to the lake is a 2.5km descent of 250m of moderate, rocky switchbacks. The 10km distance is return.
directions: The trail starts behind the Logan Pass visitor centre in Glacier National Park. Just follow the hordes, but PLEASE stay on the trail.
title: Hidden Lake (Montana)
